thread.title: Browns lose in most Browns way imaginable against Chargers
thread.title_full: Browns lose in most Browns way imaginable against Chargers - CBSSports.com

author: Ryan Wilson
title: Browns lose in most Browns way imaginable against Chargers
text:
You can take the Browns out of Cleveland, but no matter where they're playing ... they're still the Browns. The latest reminder came in the final seconds of Sunday's game in San Diego.
With it all tied at 27 and two seconds on the clock, Chargers kicker Josh Lambo honked a 39-yard attempt that would have won it. But Browns cornerback Tramon Wiliams was flagged for offsides ...

The Browns lost to the Chargers in a very Cleveland way. http://t.co/dZEsVhIX65 pic.twitter.com/xzNz9SOM1E 
— SB Nation (@SBNation) October 4, 2015 ... And on the retry, Lambo striped the 34-yarder (duh). Good luck explaining yourself, Tramon. ( CBS ) The online reaction was as swift as it was predictable, starting with the sad sack running the Browns' Twitter feed.
MISSED! Flag on the play. And we'll do this again. Ugh.
— Cleveland Browns (@Browns) October 4, 2015 How Cleveland of them. #CLEvsSD 
— Adam Rank (@adamrank) October 4, 2015 pic.twitter.com/Smjd6PThZz 
— Timothy Burke (@bubbaprog) October 4, 2015 That's the Brownsiest thing since their starting quarterback got knocked out diving into the end zone on the first drive of the season
— Ollie Connolly (@OllieUKEZ) October 4, 2015 Even the play-by-play seems to be mocking the Browns.

(CBSSports.com) The Browns fall to 1-3 while the Chargers improve to 2-2.
Topics: Josh Lambo , Ryan Wilson , Cleveland Browns , San Diego Chargers , NFL
